column4: Hi, i installed nvidia drivers without problems, but when i change xconfig file from "nv" to "nvidia" xserver refuse to start saying no module nvidia and could not load glx, any idea what to do?
you installed ubuntu packages?
ubuntu packeges? im slightly n00b so i dont know exactrly what you mean but i installed ubutu, upgraded it and folowen howto from ubuntuforums to install.... =\
well i did install drivers without problem atleast as it sad to me, but when i change xconfig file it refuse to start....
you installed ubuntu packages, or something off of nvidia.com?
ah is that what you ment, i installed/kompiled drivers from nvidia, doesnt it work on ubunu?
it does, but it's not supported here.  We prefer the ubuntu packages
please read the wiki page re: nvidia, and use the ubuntu packages
ok ok, ill look into it.... thanks, hope itll start orelese ill be back with same question :P later
take it easy :)
well i did exactly as it sad, when i restart xserver i get nvidia logo and then it crashes again
have you looked at your /var/log/Xorg.0.log?
(EE) Failed to initialize GLX extension (Compatible NVIDIA X driver not found)
which nvidia drivers did you install?  ubuntu packages?
ubuntu packeges did not work at all, so i installed 8756 from nvidia and it works untill i reboot
are you booting into a kernel other than what you built nvidia modules from?
no kernel veresion is the same its nvidia module that changes to another after reboot
as I mentioned earlier, ubuntu packages are preferred

yes but the link you gave says: install nvidia-config (or something) and nvidia-glx, and i cant install both it uninstalls one of them so i can only have eather glx or config and when i proceed anyway with glx it installs but refuses to boot becouse module is missing or something i dont remember now
the wiki page shouldn't suggest nvidia-config

well maybee it wasnt config i dont remember now, but it was something that i can not have at the same time as glx but it did install anyway no problem there but when xconfig file is changed it refused to boot
what was the error/problem?
it was something with /etc/X11/xserver/SecurityPolicy missing
